Package org.apache.karaf.main.lock

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Lock  
    LockCallBack
    Allows to react on events generated by the locking framework
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    DefaultJDBCLock
    Represents an exclusive lock on a database, used to avoid multiple Karaf instances attempting to become master.
    DerbyJDBCLock
    Represents an exclusive lock on a database, used to avoid multiple Karaf instances attempting to become master.
    GenericDataSource  
    GenericJDBCLock
    This class is the base class used to provide a master/slave configuration for a given set of active karaf instances using JDBC.
    GenericStatements
    This class is used to create the sql statements for the Karaf lock tables that are used for clustering of Karaf instances.
    LockFactory  
    MySQLJDBCLock
    Represents an exclusive lock on a database, used to avoid multiple Karaf instances attempting to become master.
    NoLock  
    OracleJDBCLock
    Represents an exclusive lock on a database, used to avoid multiple Karaf instances attempting to become master.
    PostgreSQLJDBCLock
    Represents an exclusive lock on a database, used to avoid multiple Karaf instances attempting to become master.
    SimpleFileLock  
    SQLServerJDBCLock
    Represents an exclusive lock on a database, used to avoid multiple Karaf instances attempting to become master.
    Statements
